chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall z : Z, 0 <= z -> z <> 0 -> z <> 1 -> (z | 2) -> z = 2

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
sqr_spos : forall z : Z, z <> 0 -> z * z > 0
OMEGA7 : forall x y z t : Z, z > 0 -> t > 0 -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x * z + y * t
QArith_base.Qpower = fun (q : QArith_base.Q) (z : Z) => match z with | 0 => {| QArith_base.Qnum := 1; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} | Z.pos p => QArith_base.Qpower_positive q p | Z.neg p => QArith_base.Qinv (QArith_base.Qpower_positive q p) end : QArith_base.Q -> Z -> QArith_base.Q Arguments QArith_base.Qpower _%Q_scope _%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qmult_le_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} z -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult z x) (QArith_base.Qmult z y) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
BinIntDef.Z.abs = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos p | Z.neg p => Z.pos p end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.abs _%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qle_lt_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qlt y z -> QArith_base.Qlt x z
QArith_base.Qle_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qle y z -> QArith_base.Qle x z
OMEGA17 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
BinIntDef.Z.log2 = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos (p~1)%positive | Z.pos (p~0)%positive => Z.pos (Pos.size p) | _ => 0 end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.log2 _%Z_scope
ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt_dec : forall x y z : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal, ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt x y -> ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt x z + ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt z y
QArith_base.Qmult_le_r : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} z -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult x z) (QArith_base.Qmult y z) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.to_nat = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos p => Pos.to_nat p | _ => 0%nat end : Z -> nat Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_nat _%Z_scope
not_divide1 : forall a b : Z, a <> 1 -> a <> -1 -> b <> 0 -> ~ (a * b | b)
sqr_lt : forall a : Z, a <> 0 -> a <> 1 -> a < a * a
QArith_base.Qplus_le_r : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qplus z x) (QArith_base.Qplus z y) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
not_rel_prime2 : forall x y d : Z, (d | x) -> (d | y) -> d <> 1 -> d <> -1 -> ~ rel_prime x y
Z.log2_add_le : forall a b : Z, a <> 1 -> b <> 1 -> Z.log2 (a + b) <= Z.log2 a + Z.log2 b
Z.log2_up_add_le : forall a b : Z, a <> 1 -> b <> 1 -> Z.log2_up (a + b) <= Z.log2_up a + Z.log2_up b
relp_neq : forall m n : Z, m <> 1 -> m <> -1 -> rel_prime m n -> m <> n
Z.mul_reg_r : forall n m p : Z, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p -> n = m
Z.divide_1_r_nonneg : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> (n | 1) -> n = 1
Z.log2_spec : forall n : Z, 0 < n -> 2 ^ Z.log2 n <= n < 2 ^ Z.succ (Z.log2 n)
QArith_base.Qplus_le_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qplus x z) (QArith_base.Qplus y z) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
QArith_base.Qplus_lt_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qplus x z) (QArith_base.Qplus y z) < -> QArith_base.Qlt x y
ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus = fun x y : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal => let (xn, limx) := x in let (yn, limy) := y in let H : ConstructiveCauchyReals.QSeqEquiv (fun n : nat => QArith_base.Qplus (xn n) (yn n)) (fun n : nat => QArith_base.Qplus (xn n) (yn n)) (fun p : positive => Init.Nat.max (Pos.to_nat (2 * p)) (Pos.to_nat (2 * p))) := ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus_cauchy xn xn yn Pos.to_nat limx limy in exist (fun x0 : nat -> QArith_base.Q => ConstructiveCauchyReals.QCauchySeq x0 Pos.to_nat) (fun n : nat => QArith_base.Qplus (xn (2 * n)%nat) (yn (2 * n)%nat)) (fun (p : positive) (k n...
QArith_base.Q_Setoid = {| RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive := fun x : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qeq_refl x; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) => QArith_base.Qeq_sym x y H; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) (H0 : QArith_base.Qeq y z) => QArith_base.Qeq_trans x y z H H0 |} : RelationClasses.Equivalence QArith_base.Qeq
Z.eq_mul_1_nonneg' : forall n m : Z, 0 <= m -> n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
Z.eq_mul_1_nonneg : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
OMEGA8 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> x = - y -> x = 0
